title: 5-Minute Hummus Recipe
text:
How do you improve on something that’s already pretty beloved? For starters, you could make it accessible without sacrificing quality. Michael Solomonov and Steven Cook of the Philadelphia restaurant Zahav found success with their hummus recipe, but in their second book, “Israeli Soul,” the two came up with this smart improvement, done in a fraction of the time of the original. It’s just as satisfying, and packed with tahini flavor, a given since it calls for a whole 16-ounce jar. (Another advantage? No leftover tahini languishing in the back of your fridge for months.) The end result is nutty and smooth, and topped with roasted vegetables, a worthy weeknight meal.

Featured in: The 19 Best Cookbooks Of Fall 2018.
